intro: Descurainia stricta f. umbellifera, commonly known as the yellow rocket, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and pinnately compound leaves with a distinctive yellow-green color. The plant produces small, bright yellow flowers arranged in an umbel, which is a key feature of its common name. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. This species is known for its rapid growth and ability to colonize open habitats.
